pages.title: Enchanting
pages.text: $(concept)Enchanting/$ has been overhauled, both to prevent $(entity)Villagers/$ from completely devaluing the $(item)Enchanting Tables/$, and to encourage exploration, while also increasing the determinism of the $(item)Enchanting Tables/$.

The $(item)Enchanting Table's/$ range has been increased from 5x5x2 to 7x7x3. It will also apply curses to items by default, though placing $(item)Candles/$ within range will decrease the probability of curses appearing. Placing sixteen $(item)Candles/$ will prevent curses from being applied. Conversely, $(item)Soul Flames/$ or $(item)Soul Torches/$ will increase the likelihood of curses appearing.
The $(item)Anvil/$ cannot apply enchantments from books. However, when repairing items, there is no experience cost, and it can be done infinitely many times.

pages.title: Enchanted Books
pages.text: Because the $(item)Anvil/$ does not apply enchantments, the $(item)Enchanting Table/$ must be used for all enchantments. The $(item)Enchanting Table/$ has access to basic enchantments by default. Additional enchantments can be added to the pool by placing $(item)Enchanted Books/$ within $(item)Chiseled Bookshelves/$ within range.

pages.title: Enchantment Sources
pages.text: The following enchantments are available from the $(item)Enchanting Table/$ by default:$(li)Unbreaking$(li)Protection$(li)Sharpness$(li)Efficiency$(li)Impaling$(li)Power/$
